text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bahraini press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Bahrain hoteliers voice concern over huge increase in municipality tax as industry recovers from slump.
- Young Bahrainis will soon be receiving government help to set up their own business, minister says.
- The Omani subsidiary of oil giant Shell plans to go public.
- African industrial team to visit Bahrain in March to discuss establishing joint industrial projects.
- Committee of four Gulf Arab foreign ministers set up to contain territorial dispute between Bahrain and Qatar arrives in Bahrain.
- Labour ministry to finance a study on the engineering profession in Bahrain. Three international consulting companies have submitted proposals.
